messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
ComfyUI-Static-Primitives adds Static Primitives to ComfyUI, mainly to work with reroute nodes and help simplify avoiding wire spaghetti in the user interface.
How can you install ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
To install ComfyUI-Static-Primitives, you need to clone the repo inside your custom_nodes folder using the command: `git clone https://github.com/80sVectorz/ComfyUI-Static-Primitives.git`
What new node category is added by ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
ComfyUI-Static-Primitives adds a new node category called 'primitives'.
Which basic data-types are covered by the primitives in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
ComfyUI-Static-Primitives includes a primitive for all the basic data-types.
What is the collection type system in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
The collection type system in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives allows users to add custom collection types. By default, it includes samplers and schedulers.
How can users add their own collection primitives in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?

Users can find information on how to add their own collection primitives in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives by referring to the file located at https://github.com/80sVectorz/ComfyUI-Static-Primitives/blob/main/collection_primitives/collection_primitives_readme.md.
Why were static primitives created for ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?

Static primitives were created for ComfyUI-Static-Primitives because reroutes don't work with dynamic primitives. Static primitives have a predefined type and can work with reroutes, helping to simplify the user interface and avoid wire spaghetti.
Where should the custom primitive collection files be placed in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
The custom primitive collection files should be placed in the directory 'ComfyUI-Static-Primitives/collection_primitives/'.
What is the file extension for the custom primitive collection files?
The custom primitive collection files should have a '.json' file extension.
In the example provided, what are the two main key value pairs in the JSON structure?
In the example provided, the two main key value pairs in the JSON structure are 'scheduler' and 'sampler'.
What does the key in the JSON structure represent?
The key in the JSON structure represents the display name of their respective nodes.
What does the value of each key in the JSON structure represent?
The value of each key in the JSON structure is a list of strings that directly translate to the options for the node's dropdown.
What should be avoided when creating keys across files in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
It is important to avoid having duplicate keys across files in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives.
What happens if duplicate keys are found while loading in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives?
If any duplicate keys are found while loading in ComfyUI-Static-Primitives, all definitions with that key will be ignored.
